Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2009 08:21AM julielb wrote: Thanks ladies !!!  I so appreciate your helpful info.  They have helped me to not feel quite so dark right now.  I feel panicked, fearful, mourning all over again.  i just recently lost my mom to Invasive Ductal Carc. and it brings it all to the surface again.  I went through it with her but now it feels like I am floating in a fog and can't get my head around it.  Thanks to all of you.  AlisNana- I am in between Ft. Worth and Abilene.  Same distance to each.  I have been told that with my "minimal type cancer" MD Anderson is probably not where I should consider.  They specialize in more difficult/involved cancers and that I wouldn't like it. Any thoughts.

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2009 10:16PM julielb wrote: Tami- Thanks for the reply.  I am relieved that I found this org.  I have "Googled" til I think my brain cells are affected as well as my boobs.  Info overload.  I know, I know... information is power.
Posts.Title: What do I do first Surgery/Oncology?? julielb julielb

Posts.Content: julielb wrote: I just found out that I have DCIS and wouldn't you know it ... I have to go through the weekend in turmoil.  I went to my primary doctor and she rec that I see a surgeon and an oncologist.  My question is which one do I see first.  I should have asked her but... shock was prevailing.  I live outside of Ft Worth, Texas (2 hours) and don't have a clue about any of the doctors.  I don't want to "interview" I just want to get this going.  Second question... should I just go on to MD Anderson in Houston (5 hours) or try to do this locally? Dx 4/22/2009, DCIS, <1cm, Stage II Log in to post a reply
